channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024060268
item.description:
Report X-2024060268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND TEARING ON ONE SIDE. PACKAGE DAMAGED IN TRANSIT, TOO MUCH WEIGHT ON PACKAGE. TWO BOTTLES LEAKED FROM LOOSE AND DAMAGED CAPS. SOME DENTS ON ONE LEAKING BOTTLE. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024051641
item.description:
Report X-2024051641

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package observed damaged by package handler unloading trailer. Package removed and isolated in lined hazmat tote. No other package in the area appeared affected by this minimal leak. Loose cap allowed liquid or corrosive gas to leak out of container.

item.title: Report X-2024051296
item.description:
Report X-2024051296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-06T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon inspection of the package it was found that the product was spilled all over the box due to the paint can lid popping off. This was caused by no paint can clips as well as improper packing for transportation. Per the SDS, the item is a flammable liquid however, the label or the box do not have indication that it was a hazmat.

item.title: Report X-2024060033
item.description:
Report X-2024060033

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The contents arrived in a different box than it was originally shipped in based on pictures in spidr and neither the current box nor the original one had any markings to indicate the contents were DOT regulated in any way. Initial inspection shows that the package was soaking wet on the side of the box. When interior inspection was done I found 6 plastic 28 oz bottles that all had loose caps and all spilled out a little. Estimated amount spilled is about 14oz.

item.title: Report X-2024051263
item.description:
Report X-2024051263

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: SAN FRANCISCO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the SFOR facility. The fiber board box contained two one gallon jugs and the caps on both jugs were loose spilling the contents. The jugs were packaged with bubble wrap for dunnage. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024051249
item.description:
Report X-2024051249

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A GROUND TO HAWAII SERVICE PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED PRIOR TO FLIGHT TO HAWAII DUE TO A RATTLE SOUND HEARD COMING FROM THE BOX. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION WE CAN SEE A COVERED LIMITED QUANTITY MARK BLEEDING THROUGH THE THERMAL LABEL. UPON BOX INSPECTION REVEALED FOUR X 3.5 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE SPAZ STIX PREMIUM PAINTS SPRAY PAINT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
